title: Cray environment for CUDAHOSTCXX is goofed

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

On CoriGPU I am building lbann using GCC 8.2.0 and cmake is unable to resolve CUDAHOSTCXX because spack setups up a cray environment even though I am not using one.  It ends up with CUDAHOSTCXX=CC, which is wrong.


### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->

```console
CMake Error at /global/u2/v/vanessen/spack.git/opt/spack/cray-cnl7-skylake_avx512/gcc-8.2.0/cmake-3.18.0-esuryqzyhasr24bju42ydqhlnvlvmd4b/share/cmake-3.18/Modules/CMakeDetermineCUDACompiler.cmake:46 (message):
  Could not find compiler set in environment variable CUDAHOSTCXX:
  CC.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:264 (enable_language)
```

```console
[lbann-dev-skylake_avx512] vanessen@cgpu12:~/lbann.git/build/gnu.Release.cgpu.nersc.gov/build> printenv CUDAHOSTCXX
CC
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

CoriGPU
